title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: How KONE is creating smarter, safer, and greener elevators
How KONE is creating smarter, safer, and greener elevators
Reliance Q2 profit rises 14% YoY to ₹22,092 crore on strong growth across O2C, Jio and Retail
Coca-Cola eyes $1B IPO for Indian bottling unit
items.summary:
- *Coca-Cola* is weighing a potential IPO of its Indian bottling arm, Hindustan Coca-Cola Beverages, aiming for about $1 billion.
- The unit could be valued around $10 billion, though bankers have not been hired yet and timing remains uncertain.
- If it proceeds, the deal could occur next year as India’s IPO market stays hot and global firms push listings.

items.title: Indian pharma eyes Russian market: Firms explore localised production; target to build largest API hub
Govt working on steps to improve supply of rare earth minerals: Piyush Goyal
MP pitches investment in power, renewables, white goods
items.summary:
- MP govt, with CII, hosted a Mumbai session on *power, renewables* and *white goods*, chaired by CM Mohan Yadav, underscoring MP as a manufacturing hub.
- Andre Eckholt of Hettich India SAARC announced over ₹1,000 crore invested in MP with plans to rise to ₹1,500 crore in five years, supporting *Make in India* and local jobs.
- PM MITRA Park at Dhar and the Narmadapuram Manufacturing Zone boost investor interest, highlighting MP’s focus on 2025 growth and its role in Make in India.

items.title: JSW Steel Q2 profit rises multifold to ₹1,646 cr
India's defence exports hit ₹25k cr; target ₹50k by 2029
items.summary: - India’s defence exports have reached a record ₹25,000 crore, with a target of ₹50,000 crore in exports by 2029 and ₹3 lakh crore in domestic defence manufacturing, announced by Defence Minister *Rajnath Singh*.\n- HAL’s Nashik facility saw new production lines for the *Tejas Mk1A* and HTT-40, underscoring *self-reliance* and India's growing defence manufacturing strength.\n- The government frames the rise from under ₹1,000 crore to ₹25,000 crore as a step toward *self-reliance*, with Nashik symbolizing this shift in India's defence landscape.

items.title: Polycab India Q2 net profit up 55.64% to ₹692.95 cr
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- Polycab India reported a *55.64% YoY* rise in consolidated net profit to ₹692.95 crore for the September 2025 quarter (*Q2*).
- Revenue from operations grew *17.80%* to ₹6,477.21 crore, led by the *Wires and Cables* business and improving *FMEG* traction.
- Domestic demand remains healthy due to *government infrastructure spending* and improving private capex, with international business continuing to scale, per CMD Inder T Jaisinghani.

items.title: Trump announces a deal with a manufacturer to make a common fertility drug cheaper for IVF patients
Waaree to expand in US despite trade probe
items.summary:
- Waaree Energies aims to expand in the **US** despite a **trade probe** into its labeling of Chinese-made cells as Indian-made.
- CEO Amit Paithankar says shipments remain unaffected and the company is pursuing organic and inorganic growth in the **US**, including energy storage, while expanding Houston to 3.2 GW.
- With 16.1 GW in India and 2.6 GW in the **US**, its order book (~₹470B) shows strong **US demand** and plans to add 10 GW of solar cell and ingot-wafer capacity by 2027.

items.title: Govt extends application window PLI scheme for white goods till Nov 10
Rajnath, Adityanath flag off first BrahMos batch in Lucknow
items.summary:
- *Rajnath Singh* and *Yogi Adityanath* will flag off the first batch of **BrahMos missiles** produced at the Lucknow unit, marking a milestone for the *UP Defence Corridor*. 
- The new Integration and Test Facility in Lucknow, inaugurated on May 11, 2025, will handle missile integration, testing, and final quality checks. 
- Officials say the production will boost GST revenue for UP, create skilled jobs, and reinforce India’s *Make in India, Make for the World* goals.

items.title: BEM bets on battery swapping tech to drive India’s highway electrification
IIT Bombay’s TIH Foundation partners with Bajaj Electricals to develop smart streetlight control system
India to force drugmakers to upgrade plants after fatal cough syrup crisis
How this €46-billion German powerhouse gears up to cash in on India’s rail boom
Why copper, not steel, will power next industrial leap
Indian Army, JCBL to set NGV repair hub in Leh
items.summary:
- The Indian Army and JCBL Group inked an MoU to set up a *NGV* repair hub and OEM warehouse at the 14 Corps Zonal Workshop in Leh.
- JCBL Group (ADSL) will provide *defence manufacturing*, technical support, training, retro-modification and *R&D* through the NGV Hub, keeping fast-moving spares ready and supplying critical stores.
- Lt Gen Hitesh Bhalla emphasised that the collaboration would significantly enhance the operational readiness of 14 Corps, with plans to expand similar industry warehouses to three additional forward locations under the 14 Corps AOR.

items.title: India’s semiconductor push faces key manufacturing gap despite design strength, says report
India, Australia boost clean energy cooperation
items.summary: - India and Australia agreed to deepen cooperation in the *clean energy* sector and promote *manufacturing* and *technology sharing* by adopting best practices.\n- The leaders launched the *India-Australia Green Hydrogen Taskforce* and discussed the *Renewable Energy Partnership (REP)* and the *India-Australia Energy Dialogue*, aiming to accelerate *climate action*.\n- Modi and Albanese previously advanced this agenda at the G20, with Australia pledging to scale the partnership and support energy transition.

items.title: Crackdown on bus makers after Jaisalmer fire
items.summary:
- After the Jaisalmer bus fire that killed *21* people, the Rajasthan government announced a statewide crackdown on bus body manufacturers with urgent inspections.
- **five-member high-level committee** to examine safety lapses, as *66 buses* from the Jainam Coach Crafter premises were impounded for inspection.
- The Central Institute of Road Transport (**CIRT**), Pune, has been invited for an independent technical evaluation, while *53 buses* have been impounded for bus body code violations.

items.title: Six ARCs show interest in DLI Logistics' ₹923-cr debt
Tata Steel signs AWIPL deal for ASU O&M
items.summary:
- Tata Steel inks a 20‑year contract with **Air Water India Private Limited (AWIPL)** for the operation and maintenance of its **Air Separation Unit (ASU)** at Jamshedpur.
- The ASU will produce 1,800 tons of oxygen per day, along with nitrogen, argon, and dry air for Tata Steel’s Blast Furnaces and Steel Melting Shops.
- AWIPL will take handover as the unit stabilizes next month, with the deal signed by Peeyush Gupta and Kausik Mukhopadhyay.

items.title: CP Plus to make 90L CCTV IP cameras with L&T SCT chip
items.summary:
- CP Plus will manufacture nine million CCTV IP cameras over the next three years, powered by LTSCT's indigenously designed Vision System-on-Chip (**SoC**). 
- LTSCT claims its SoC supports up to eight‑megapixel imaging, enabling high‑quality surveillance and India’s technological sovereignty. 
- The alliance marks the first time a surveillance camera is made using chips from an Indian company, signaling strategic significance for CP Plus and Aditya Khemka.

items.title: Technology as the backbone of sustainable manufacturing and supply chains
Cement Q2 earnings likely peaked; costs may cap gains
items.summary:
- Q2 earnings are expected to have peaked as cement prices stay largely flat and *capacity additions* push up costs, capping gains.
- GST reduction to 18% is driving *price moderation*; experts expect the next price uptick only in Q1FY27E, while higher *petcoke* costs and rising fuel prices weigh on margins.
- UltraTech Cement and Adani Cement may post *double-digit volume growth*, with *EBITDA per tonne* seen at ₹850–1,150; profits could double on a low base, though EBITDA per tonne may be lower sequentially for the first time in three quarters.

items.title: Tata Power, TN govt open twin solar skill centres
items.summary:
- **Tamil Nadu** inaugurates two Solar Skill Centres of Excellence (SCoEs) in Pettai and Sattur under a **PPP** with Tata Power's TPSDI to build a renewable-ready workforce. 
- Courses follow **NCVET/NSDC standards** and MNRE's PM: Surya Ghar: Muft Bijli Yojana, with nationally recognized certifications for solar installers and technicians. 
- The initiative ties skilling to Tata Power's **4.3 GW** solar manufacturing facility in Tirunelveli to deploy a local clean-energy workforce.

items.title: Rajnath: ₹3 Lakh Cr Defence Target by 2029
items.summary:
- Rajnath Singh announced a target of *₹3 lakh crore* in annual defence manufacturing and *₹50,000 crore* in exports by 2029 to boost self-reliance.
- He cited Operation Sindoor and highlighted growth from *₹46,000 crore* to *₹1.5 lakh crore*, with private sector contributing around *₹33,000 crore*.
- He urged youths to become creators and emphasised skill development, adding that *AI* will replace those who don't use it, not humans.

items.title: Indian Air Force to receive first Tejas Mk-1A fighter jet
items.summary:
- The IAF will receive its first **Tejas Mk-1A** from HAL in a Nashik ceremony, with Defence Minister Rajnath Singh present.
- The Mk-1A, replacing the MiG-21s, is ~65% indigenous and part of a Rs 62,370 crore deal for 97 jets (68 single-seat, 29 trainer) to be deployed at Nal Air Base, Rajasthan.
- It features advanced avionics and radar, a top speed >2,200 km/h, and can carry indigenous weapons like the **BrahMos**; four GE-404 engines have arrived, with 12 more due this year.

items.title: US mid-Atlantic manufacturing contracts; prices rise
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- The *Philadelphia Fed* index dropped to -12.8 in October, signaling contraction in the *mid-Atlantic* factory activity despite rising new orders. 
- Prices paid for inputs rose to **49.2**, with over half of firms reporting higher input costs, while prices received climbed to **26.8**. 
- The report signals potential inflation pressure ahead as tariffs pass‑through continues and pre‑tariff inventories are depleted.

items.title: GHCL gets land, clearances for ₹6,500-cr soda ash plant; construction in 6-7 months
India signs $468m LMM deal with Thales
items.author: TOI World Desk, TIMESOFINDIA.COM
items.summary:
- The Indian Army signed a **$468 million** deal with **Thales UK** to procure the Light Weight Modular Missile (**LMM**), boosting India's air-defence capabilities.
- Missiles and launchers will be manufactured in **Belfast, Northern Ireland**, before being delivered to India.
- The **LMM** is a 13 kg, laser-guided, portable system with Mach 1.5 speed, capable of engaging aircraft, helicopters, UAVs/UCAVs at over 6 km in all-weather conditions, featuring a triple-effect warhead and proximity fuse.

items.title: Nestle to axe 16,000 jobs as new CEO targets sales growth
items.summary:
- *Nestle* will cut about 16,000 jobs as it looks to boost sales growth under the new CEO *Philipp Navratil*, including 12,000 white-collar and 4,000 in manufacturing.
- Navratil aims to accelerate *RIG*-led growth and raise cost savings to around **3 billion Swiss francs** by end-2027.
- The move comes amid managerial upheaval and mounting pressure to reignite growth amid rising costs and a share price decline.

items.title: Shyam Metalics eyes ₹40,000 cr revenue via Vision 2031
items.summary:
- SMEL's **Vision 2031** targets revenue of **₹40,000 crore** by 2031, a 2.5x jump.
- The plan commits **₹10,000 crore** capex funded largely by internal accruals for capacity expansion, backward integration, and *technology upgrades*.
- Capacity rises to 27 mt across **West Bengal, Odisha, Madhya Pradesh** with higher exports to **US$300 million** and 10,000+ jobs.

items.title: Kineco, BEML tie up to boost indigenous composite manufacturing
items.summary:
- **Kineco** and **BEML** signed an MoU at IREE 2025 to boost *indigenous composite manufacturing* for defence, aerospace, and mass transit, combining Kineco's high‑performance materials with BEML's engineering capabilities.
- The partnership aims to strengthen *India's self-reliance* in *advanced materials* and create a robust, future‑ready *indigenous ecosystem* across defence and related sectors.
- It signals a strategic move toward *global‑standard solutions* and build a lasting *indigenous ecosystem* for domestic manufacturing in defence, aerospace, and mass transit.

items.title: AINMA warns MSME notebook closures as imports rise
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- AINMA warns that over 1,500 notebook MSMEs face closure due to a surge in imports from *ASEAN countries* and an *inverted duty structure* that harms domestic producers and the **Make in India** push.
- They have written to the Finance and Commerce ministries arguing that **zero-tax imports under GST** could undercut local prices and livelihoods.
- S. Saravanakumar of AINMA calls for an urgent corrective mechanism to restore a level playing field and safeguard the notebook ecosystem, aligning with the PM's *swadeshi* vision.

items.title: Blue Energy Motors launches electric heavy-duty truck with battery swapping technology
NMDC Steel first BIS for pipeline-grade hot-rolled steel
items.summary:
- *NMDC Steel* became India's first company to obtain a BIS licence to manufacture pipeline-grade hot-rolled steel under *IS 18384:2023* for Welded Steel Pipe used in pipeline transportation.
- The license was conferred on *World Standards Day 2025* in Raipur, with CMD *Amitava Mukherjee* receiving it in the presence of *Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Vishnu Deo Sai*.
- This milestone strengthens domestic capability and aligns with NMDC Steel's Nagarnar 3.0 MTPA plant to meet national and international standards for critical industries.

items.title: Rolls-Royce expands Bharat Forge blade deal
items.summary: - *Rolls-Royce* expands with *Bharat Forge* to manufacture and supply fan blades for Pearl 700 and Pearl 10X, inked at the Dahlewitz facility near Berlin, boosting *Make in India*.\n- The deal builds on Bharat Forge’s Pearl 700 work since 2020, with the first zero-defect blade in 2024, now extending to Pearl 10X.\n- Pearl 10X delivers over 18,000 pounds of thrust, underscoring India’s growing aerospace capability with Rolls-Royce’s long-standing local presence.

items.title: Celcius Logistics & Switch Mobility to launch electric reefer fleet
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary:
- **Celcius Logistics** signs an MoU with **Switch Mobility** to deploy 350 electric light commercial vehicles (**eLCVs**) for refrigerated transport, marking India’s largest bulk order for eLCVs.
- Under the *Celcius Green* vertical, the fleet will start in New Delhi and expand to Mumbai, Bengaluru, and Hyderabad, with ARR targets of ₹50 crore in year 1 and ₹250 crore over five years.
- It includes *GPS live tracking*, humidity/temperature sensors, lane-specific charging, and predictive maintenance, backed by ₹100 crore plus ₹100–150 crore for expansion.

items.title: Blue Dart opens largest integrated ground hub in Haryana
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- Blue Dart opened its largest integrated ground hub in *Pataudi*, Haryana, consolidating operations under one roof to boost connectivity, scalability, and efficiency.
- The 50,558 sqm facility, located ~50 km from Delhi airport, offers *multimodal connectivity* to Delhi-NCR and major expressways, reducing vehicle movement by 30% and raising throughput by ~10–15%.
- Operational through 2033 with automation and motorised conveyors, the hub features an auto sorter of 200,000 shipments/day (2,283 tons daily) and serves 19,000+ pin codes as part of Blue Dart's expanding express network.

items.title: Apple vows to keep its bet on China amid trade tensions
Zetwerk expands BIS-compliant manufacturing in India
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary: - Zetwerk launches BIS-compliant manufacturing at its Noida facility to supply BIS-ready consumer and industrial electrical products, emphasizing *BIS* certification. - The expansion aligns with government norms, accelerating domestic production and helping brands meet mandatory standards for the *Made in India* push. - Leaders say investments in *R&D*, testing, and standardized processes enable scalable, compliant manufacturing and position brands for global reach.

items.title: RHI Magnesita commissions India’s first Robotic Caster System at JSW Vijayanagar
items.summary: - RHI Magnesita commissioned India's first *robotic caster* at JSW Vijayanagar as part of its *4PRO* automation for casting.\n- The system handles 350-tonne ladles, running continuously to reduce human exposure to molten metal and boost safety, efficiency and product quality.\n- Integrated sensors and vision enable real-time monitoring, lowering scrap/rework and contributing to the Indian steel industry's automation push.

items.title: ZF enters Indian railway sector with first gearbox order
items.summary: - ZF Group India will assemble railway gearboxes at its *Coimbatore* facility in *Tamil Nadu*, localising production for India's rail sector and advancing **Make in India**.\n- The first order targets a single-stage spur gear drive for the *Vande Bharat Express*, capable of 70–170 km/h with coupling and reaction-rod systems tailored to this semi high-speed train.\n- The move expands *ZF Group India* beyond automotive driveline into railways, signaling a more sustainable, reliable railway solution strategy for India's growing infrastructure.

items.title: How CJ Darcl is reimagining smart logistics
Ola Shakti: Ola’s entry into energy storage
items.summary: - *Ola Shakti* is a residential energy storage solution from *Ola Electric*, built on the *4680 Bharat Cell* platform, offered in four configurations and designed for Indian homes.\n- The product marks Ola’s move beyond electric mobility and targets the ₹1 lakh crore BESS market, with ambitions to scale to about 5 GWh annual Gigafactory consumption.\n- Specs include up to 98% efficiency, 120–290V input, IP67 weatherproofing, 2-hour charging, 1.5 hours of backup, and app-based monitoring and control.

items.title: BluPine Energy lands 150 MW FDRE from SJVN Green Energy
items.summary: - *BluPine Energy* secures a **150 MW FDRE** project from *SJVN Green Energy* via its SPV **Solarcraft Power India 16 Pvt Ltd** at ₹6.75 per kWh. - The project combines solar, wind and battery energy storage to enable reliable dispatch during peak hours and strengthen grid stability. - A **25-year PPA** underpins BluPine's expanding national portfolio, backed by Actis.
